TaxonIdentification.variety_authority: W. C. Holmes, K. L. Yip & Rushing

treatment.description: Plants 1–3 m; young thorns densely puberulent; mature thorns 20–60 mm, 2–3.4 mm at base (15 or less times longer than base width). Flowers: petals ca. 3 mm; style 0.4–0.7 mm, straight (sometimes slightly curved when dry); gynophore (stipe) 0.3–0.5 mm.
treatment.discussion: Variety wivaggii is primarily a taxon of the Chihuahuan Desert, occurring in a region between the more easterly var. spinosa and the more westerly var. tenuispina.
